alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Aroostook County through 715 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Smyrna Mills, or 18 miles west of Houlton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Smyrna, Smyrna Mills, Dudley Township, Oakfield, Ludlow, Merrill, Dyer Brook, Webbertown and Moro Plantation. This includes State Highway 11 near Knowles Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. A flood advisory is currently in effect for small stream and creek flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
